entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as the main antagonist who singled out Harry as a threat to him. ("Voldemort singled you out as the person who would be most dangerous to him")

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a wise and experienced wizard who corrects Harry's understanding of the prophecy. ("Pointing at Harry with his black, withered hand, he said, 'You are setting too much store by the prophecy!')

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the main protagonist who is confused about the prophecy. ("'But,' spluttered Harry , 'but you said the prophecy means --')

entities.name: trelawney
entities.description: Professor Trelawney is mentioned as a seer who provided information to Voldemort that led to his grave error. ("If Voldemort had never heard of the prophecy , would it have been fulfilled? Would it have meant anything? Of course not! Do you think every prophecy in the Hall of Prophecy has been fulfilled?')

relationships.description: Voldemort singled out Harry as a threat to him. ("Voldemort singled you out as the person who would be most dangerous to him")

Dumbledore corrected Harry's understanding of the prophecy, implying that Voldemort made a grave error. ("'Harry , Harry , only because Voldemort made a grave error, and acted on Professor Trelawneyâ€™s words!')

Voldemort acted upon Professor Trelawney's words. ("If Voldemort had never heard of the prophecy , would it have been fulfilled? Would it have meant anything? Of course not! Do you think every prophecy in the Hall of Prophecy has been fulfilled?')
